oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Influence of Using a Neomycin and Chlorobutanol Compound in Dry Cow Treatment on the Control of Mastitis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Weinland, K. M.
Kirkham, W. W.
Morrow, M. E.
Ranck, F. M.
Ewbank, T. A.
Dillon, W. M.
Parmelee, C. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: antibiotics
drugs
dry period
mastitis
treatment
aminoglycoside antibiotics
chlorobutanol
drying off
midicines
pharmaceuticals
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dry treatment of about one-half of a 60-cow herd with a neomycin and chlorobutanol compound over a three-year period reduced the number of positive California Mastitis Test (CMT) scores. This effect was greatest during the first ten days after calving. Streptococcal infections were reduced but not staphylococcal infections. Dry treatment with the antibiotic compound reduced the risk that a cow would be culled because of mastitis.
